reviews.review_msg: Jeff is a great professor who tries to make the boring criminological theory stuff interesting with examples and personal stories. He is very organized and his exams are directly from the content in the slides and lectures making them very easy to do well on! (btw the textbook for this particular class was not super important so maybe save your $)

Jeff was thrown into our class the middle of the semester in replacement of our previous professor. Despite this inconvenience Jeff still did a great job at teaching us the content without making things too confusing. Lecture heavy, so pay attention in class. Lecture slides are a clear and organized, few points and uses own anecdotes to simplify.

Lecture heavy, with little time for note taking of your own. Power points are helpful for studying off and exams are fair. However, while he makes himself accessible to students, he is very condescending and rude when answering questions. Little guidance was given for assignments. Ruined the experience for me completely, I felt held back by him.

Very average teacher. If you're a hands on learner who doesn't learn well through lecture, do not take this class. He talks the whole class, no group work or anything interactive. Lectures are dragged on and boring, hard to understand sometimes. Heavily based on slides and text. Reasonable/fair marker but his tests can be confusing.
amazing teacher, relatable to students with easy and clear guidelines

Aynsley cares so much for her students. She's extremely responsive to outreach for help. The course I took with her was pretty heavy, with a lot of information you need to retain. Her tests are extensive so you should prioritize studying. 

Quite frankly one of the kindest professors I've ever had.

She is a great professor overall and really nice and gave us an opportunity to get extra credit. But I will say she is hard marker on our papers and her exams are very written question heavy (written portion was worth 65/110). There was a lot of material to study for and I was exhausted after her final exam. 
Midterm was worth 20%. Final was 30%.

I can honestly say that Aynsley was one of the best profs I've had. She is young so she understands how to communicate with her students, and she makes lectures super interesting to go to! Also is a semi easy marker. She is super friendly and doesn't make you nervous when you need to ask her something! LOVE her

Aynsley is kind, funny, and approachable. No, she doesn't post her notes online, but this is actually a blessing in disguise, because then you're forced to take lots of notes (highly recommend bringing a laptop, unless you enjoy carpal tunnel) and pay attention, so you really learn! I'm not a crim student, but I would recommend Aynsley to anyone :)

His lectures are the most interesting ones out of all the others I have been to, I would really like to take his classes for the upcoming semesters. Very friendly and helpful, always responds to emails.

He is a great professor! Very interested in what he teaches and tries to keep class entertaining for everyone! He normally doesn't post slides unless by special request, and that is fine, since writing notes keeps students engaged.
